agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Health & Human Services TIME & DATE: 8:30 AM, Wednesday, April 10, 2019 PLACE: Senate Chamber CHAIR: Senator Lois Kolkhorst To consider the following: SB 429 Lucio Relating to a comprehensive plan for increasing and improving the workforce in this state to serve persons with mental health and substance use issues. SB 916 Johnson Relating to supportive palliative care. SB 1033 Hancock | et al. Relating to information regarding perinatal palliative care and prohibiting discriminatory abortions; creating an administrative penalty, a civil remedy, and a criminal offense. SB 1109 Lucio Relating to a public outreach campaign for aging adults with visual impairments. SB 1120 Lucio Relating to health professional continuing education to address communicable and other diseases in border counties. SB 1122 Lucio Relating to the establishment of a sanitarian recruitment and retention program in border counties for public health purposes. SB 1124 Lucio Relating to establishment of a border public health response team. SB 1519 Kolkhorst Relating to a council on long-term care facilities. SB 1552 Lucio Relating to state supported living centers. SB 1565 Fallon Relating to the medical authorization required to release protected health information in a health care liability claim. SB 1805 Rodríguez Relating to egg grading. SB 2021 Miles Relating to providing access to local health departments and certain health service regional offices under the Medicaid managed care program. SB 2040 Rodríguez Relating to a report regarding Medicaid reimbursement rates and access to care. SB 2089 Hughes | et al. Relating to advance directives or health care or treatment decisions made by or on behalf of patients. SB 2129 Creighton Relating to advance directives and health care and treatment decisions. SB 2243 Paxton | et al. Relating to required counseling before an abortion is performed. SB 2355 Lucio Relating to conflicts of interest and discrimination policies for an ethics or medical committee review of an advance directive. Pending Business Oral testimony: fill out a paper witness card and submit to the Clerk. Oral and written testimony: fill out a paper witness card and hold on to your documents until your name is called to the table. Position only: register using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways or by going to Http://swrs on public-capitol. Written testimony only: register your position using the Senate kiosk then bring your 20 copies, with your name on each copy, to the Assistant Clerk, during the hearing. Public oral testimony will be limited to 2 minutes Bills added after last posting: SB 1120 SB 1122 SB 1124 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
